question: 暮らす
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>livelihood</kanji>. The verb version is <vocabulary>to live</vocabulary>. It's not really "to live" literally, though. It's more like <vocabulary>to live one's life</vocabulary>, rather than just to live.
sourceReadingMnemonic: If anyone is going <vocabulary>to live one's life</vocabulary>, it's gotta be the great <reading>Ku</reading>blai Khan (<ja>く</ja>). He conquered most of the world and was super badass.
